item.title: The Grain Trap: How Diet Shapes Destiny Through Lamarckian Lenses
item.description:
The substrate of civilization: grain has shaped not just our agriculture, but our very biology and consciousness

The Uncomfortable Truth

Here’s a statement that makes people squirm: “The most emaciated, low-vitality cultures that racists berate eat the most grain.”

Before you recoil, pause. What if we flipped this from an ugly stereotype into a scientific hypothesis? What if the apparent “low vitality” isn’t about racial essence, but about environmental programmingâ€”a neo-Lamarckian process where persistent dietary inputs literally reshape human biology, microbiomes, and cultural institutions across generations?
